alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 11:23AM CDT until April 25 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. For the Menominee River...including McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near McAllister. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Water covers the boat docks near the river gauge and there is extensive flooding of wooded lowland areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 13.4 feet by next Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
